labels.analysis: The Panintellegence API MCP Server is designed to interact with the Panintellegence PI Dashboard API, enabling seamless management of dashboard resources such as categories, charts, and authentication. Its core functionality revolves around managing and retrieving dashboard data, handling authentication, and providing access to filtered and exportable chart data. Tools like 'list-categories', 'list-charts', and 'export-chart' indicate its utility in data retrieval and presentation, while authentication tools ('authenticate', 'keep-session-alive') emphasize secure API interaction. The server appears to act as a bridge between users (or AI assistants) and the PI Dashboard API, facilitating data operations, authentication management, and access control.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "API Integration" was chosen because the server's main purpose is to interact with and manage an external API (the PI Dashboard). Secondary labels like "Data Analysis & Processing" are included due to the server's ability to retrieve and filter dashboard data, which is commonly used for analytical purposes. The custom label "Dashboard Management" was added to describe the server's specific role in managing and interacting with dashboard resources, which is not explicitly covered by predefined categories.

server_info_crawled.name: Panintellegence API MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @mingzilla/pi-api-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Interact with the Panintellegence PI Dashboard API seamlessly. Access and manage dashboard resources like categories and charts securely, enabling your AI assistants to provide actionable insights effortlessly.

tools.name: get-filterable-attributes

tools.description: Check if the current API URL and authentication are valid

tools.description: Set the API base URL for all requests

tools.name: authenticate
tools.description: Guide for authenticating with the PI API

tools.name: keep-session-alive
tools.description: Verify and refresh the current authentication token (also used for token-based authentication)

tools.name: authenticate-with-credentials
tools.description: Authenticate with the PI API using username and password (last resort option)

tools.name: logout
tools.description: Invalidate the current token and end the session

tools.name: set-organization
tools.description: Set the organization ID for subsequent requests

tools.name: list-categories
tools.description: List all categories with filtering support

tools.name: list-category-objects
tools.description: List all objects for a specific category

tools.name: list-charts
tools.description: List all charts with filtering support

tools.name: export-chart
tools.description: Export a chart in various formats

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mingzilla/pi-api-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
